item.title: Scheduling a Python script using PythonAnywhere and cron-job.org
item.description: Scheduling a script is one of those jobs that sounds like it should be easy, but is surprisingly tricky. Here, I walk you through one of the easier ways of doing so, by hosting the script on PythonAnywhere to give it a URL, and scheduling it to run using cron-job.org, both of which offer free services. What’s so difficult? Scheduling scripts is when, instead of manually running a script whenever you need to, you tell a scheduler to run it at a given frequency or based on other events.
